post.body: Odd that it would be so localized. Still not back, sponging off neighbor's wifi
Elizabeth Warren on NPR Fresh Air last week was really illuminating. One of the few bold Harry Reid steps was drafting her
Thanks for the heads up! Good to know the "followers" will be more quality folks
Ditto for me, lost about 60 followers. Likely Twitter is removing spam and bot accounts
No, that's an old argument that is still invalid. A newswire and an encyclopedia are not mutually exclusive
Need folks to pay rent for pricey Central Park and Palm Springs digs perhaps. To be landlord and collect RMB 35k/month is glorious.
Good to hear. In Jan, financial advisor recommended I buy Merrill Lynch and $MS bank stocks. "Will always be around" he said oy
Chinese government must be preening about limiting hedge fund activity in Mainland. Fairfield Greenwich was seeking PRC investors
Are you telling me you're an investor in a Madoff fund?
Re: Fairfield Greenwich, It's going to be a mess sorting out who gets what money back, and for what reason
Bad things = makes one wonder how much American economy was actually doing real things, rather than being middlemen
Yes, friend w/Fairfield. He's not on the hook for the $$$, fortunately. Seems Feds may grab back $ of those who cashed out
In general, I agree the spectre of "Chinese hackers" is overblown, and often used by US DoD to justify funding requests
Yeah, though I think "Toyota Republicans" has a nice ring to it. Two words that you wouldn't expect to be joined together
Ha, great memories. That and the streaking French couple who danced through the sprinklers on the Lawn after Lobsterfest
Merry Xmas! Yes Beijing style has its advantages! Locals really getting into it these days: Santa hats and commercialism
Journal video site mishmash of Barrons, MW, DJ CEO interviews, stock Reuters stories, and WSJ original pieces. Hard to sift through
Re: WSJ/MW video woes, the J will suffer because ppl know it as a sub-only site, even if video is free. Lower foot traffic sadly
Have not had time to digest "Rick Warren" controversy, though surprised to see PBS Newshour has a segment dedicated to it
Twitter must have dumped some spam accounts, as I lost 60 followers suddenly. Either that or I said something really upsetting
Beijing CNC ADSL service unavailable in apt complex. Cust svc says they have been "upgrading" since last night. No uptime estimate. Grr
Zhang Yimou was a runner-up for Time Magazine Person of the Year. Interesting S. Spielberg wrote the article about him http://bit.ly/H7lP
Add this to the puzzling Wikipedia deletion parade: http://tinyurl.com/3l5xmc
DNScoop.com says: "The estimated value of http://wikipedia.org is: $571,900,000"
Wow, got the Twitter fail whale just now. First time in many many weeks.
Ironically, Fairfield Greenwich hedge fund holding Madoff-related investments was called the "Sentry Fund." No one standing guard
Yikes, just got scary message f/Google/Firefox re: cbw.com, "reported as an attack site", "malicious software being downloaded, installed"
New term being bandied about in December: "Toyota Republicans" http://bit.ly/USDK
Just realized I'm running VLC from Nov 2007; just upgraded to 0.9.8 which can play AVCHD files, CPU willing
NYT: As a Candidate, Kennedy Is Forceful but Elusive http://tinyurl.com/79n6b8 (strange last line of the article)
Beijing daoban shop crackdown? Pirated DVD shops all shutered this weekend: Toms (in Lido), row of stores in Sanlitun behind 3.3
No. You. Didn't. TN Republican Chip Saltsman defends sending CDs w/ 'Barack the Magic Negro' song http://bit.ly/16jCO
Finding cncmax.cn (China Netcom) Javascript suspiciously trying to load on some pages while surfing via Beijing DSL line. Investigating...
Finding AVCHD support on Mac like going back to 1996 with DV. Very basic support, no faster than 1x transfer. Hope 2009 portends s/t better
Going skating w/crew at Houhai lake today at 3pm. Anyone welcome to join, look for us in Santa hats and boom box
Xmas Eve in Beijing: Guizhou cuisine for dinner, getting foot massages while watching "Love Actually," munching on cookies and mangoes
Reading @steverubel "In 2009 I think we're going to see a lot of the old guard return to their roots - their blogs" http://ff.im/-nlEg
Planning Christmas Day ice skating on the frozen lake at Houhai in Beijing, hot chocolate, music and all that
Economic theory of "efficient" price logically extended (erroneously) to all parts of free market capitalism http://bit.ly/13n3t
Cool: JanusVM inline adapter that anonymizes traffic through Tor, but hate to think of resulting surfing speed http://url.ie/10kx
